channel.title: Posts on Joshuas Steak Aging
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Joshuas Steak Aging

item.title: Business model
item.description: TBD - need to think through: Revenue model Pricing Average account size and/or lifetime value Sales & distribution model Customer/pipeline list

item.title: 16lb ribeye Nov
item.description: what stats start Nov 6 end age until Nov 27 start weight 16.5lb end weight ?? butcher https://doubleddmeats.com/ roast $201 $12.7/lb salt $3.00

item.title: 10lb ribeye Sept
item.description: what stats start Aug22 end Sept 12 start weight 10lb end weight 8lb (estimated, didn’t weight) butcher https://doubleddmeats.com/ roast $130 $13/lb salt $10.08 aging Steaks on the tray. Himalayan salt in the trey. Salt block on the side. UV lights, USB fan, Humidifier, dehumidifier and inkbird controlling humidity.

item.title: Roadmap
item.description: Provide Feedback 1) Determine product viability - 3 months Establish dry aging discipline and approach Product round table / tasting / feedback Buy 21 day age choice grade Ribeye from local retail Pre-sell steaks to friends/family from the roast while aging 2) Validate margin Validate $5-10/lb margin from retail Validate business can cover $120/mo for commercial kitchen space / compliance. Find wholesale ribeye suppliers. Better meat, better terms.

item.title: Competition
item.description: Provide Feedback Gold Belly https://www.goldbelly.com/ selling dry aged choice ribeye at $33/lb Allen Brothers https://www.allenbrothers.com/ selling dry aged prime ribeye at $62/lb Costco selling dry aged prime ribeye at $52/lb They have many advantages. Experience, Existing supplier relationships to high quality grass fed beef. Ability to ship. Compliance. Provide Feedback

item.title: Market size
item.description: Provide Feedback Not sure yet. But it’s likely big. Friends and family for now. Invite only. Americans eat 849lb beef/second, per wolfram alpha. That a lot of consumers. Not sure how many people in the Kenmore / Redmond / Seattle area eat steak regularly. Need more research. Provide Feedback

item.title: Dry aging process
item.description: Provide Feedback temperature: 32-39.2deg If the temperature is above this, the germs multiply. At temperatures below the freezing point, the enzymes can not work and the meat does not ripen. humidity: 80-85% It is possible to vary the humidity easily between 60-90%. This slightly changes the flavor, which makes the final product more individual. At higher values, however, the possibility of mold attack increases. At low levels, the outer crust dries deeper and deeper.

item.title: Why now?
item.description: Provide Feedback Price. Choice quality is $3/lb more than the recent past. In September, Steak was 2x the price from prior years. Prime+ quality steaks are too expensive for most people, $30-50/lb Steak consumption doesn’t seem to be declining, even with the alternative impossible (not) meat trend. Maybe real steak consumption is increasing because of the fear of scarcity. Provide Feedback

item.title: Solution
item.description: Provide Feedback Spend the time and age steaks to increase the value. Provide better steak for less than the prime+ $30-60/lb Sell under the 3x price lift for other dry aged steaks. Provide Feedback

item.title: Problem
item.description: Provide Feedback Price. Most people choose choice quality steak, for affordability. $12/lb compared to the $16/lb for Prime. (Nov 6 2021). The prices are $3-4/lb higher than 3y average. Aged steak is even more expensive Aged steaks make an average steak even better, but can sell for 3x the price per lb. Provide Feedback

item.title: Purpose
item.description: Provide Feedback Aging steak makes something delicious even better. Dry aging tenderizes and enhances the flavor through enzymatic and bacterial action, along with the oxidation of fat. Dry-aged meat will develop beefy, nutty, and almost cheese-like aromas. Provide Feedback
